ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Overview of movement research methods, kinesthesia, choreography, scoring, etc. Also built experience in methods by moving together as a class and doing exercises!

I learned all about movement research (namely what it is)! Our class time was split into investigative movement and discussion of the readings, so we spent equal time on theory and practice of different modes of movement research.
Learned a lot about how to live in/through/alongside my body!
This course will change your life. Terms that are thrown away randomly in arts gain meaning in this course: embodiment, kinaesthesia, movement.

I learned so much about the significance of movement and the ways in which you can analyze and improve your own movement throughout life. This class allows you to understand how movement effects your communication, presence, and overall mentality throughout life. In addition, you learn a lot from many different fields of study.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I really liked this class -- we built a great community, and as someone who'd never taken a movement research class before, I was really excited to learn more. The space was very welcoming and it was always a good way to start the week.

Strengths: the practical portion of the course! Studio exploration was so illuminating and engaging. I think a weakness of the course was the amount of time spent in discussion; maybe it was this particular group, but no one seemed very engaged. I would love to explore different ways of discussing the readings!
All good stuff. Prof Coates is great. Please keep doing your thing.
There were only strengths within this class. We received clear feedback on our assignments and discussions and classes were very conducive to learning in a different way.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yep absolutely, I learned a lot and had a great time doing it. What more could one ask for?
Yes! I learned so much about critical movement studies and methods of research. I found it so refreshingly challenging.
I would absolutely recommend this course!!
